tasks: Boundary regularity for the polyharmonic Dirichlet problem
results: Solution of the m-polyharmonic Poisson equation in a Reifenberg-flat domain with homogeneous Dirichlet boundary condition, is Cm−1,α regular up to the boundary
title: Boundary Regularity for the Polyharmonic Dirichlet Problem.pdf
abstract: In this paper we prove that any solution of the m-polyharmonic Poisson equation in a Reifenberg-ﬂat domain with homogeneous Dirichlet boundary condition, is C m−1,α regular up to the boundary. To achieve this result we extend the Nirenberg method of translations to operators of arbitrary order, and then use some Mosco-convergence tools developped in a previous paper [11]. Contents 1 Introduction 2 2 Preliminaries 6 3 Interior regularity by the translation method 15 4 Boundary regularity in the case of a hyperplane 20 5 Energy decay for a Reifenberg-ﬂat boundary 24 6 Boundary regularity in a Reifenberg ﬂat domain 33 ∗Universit´e de Lorraine, CNRS, Institut Elie Cartan de Lorraine, BP 70239 54506 Vandœuvre-l`es-Nancy Cedex, France (antoine.lemenant@univ-lorraine.fr). †Institut Universitaire de France (IUF) ‡Universit´e de Lorraine, CNRS, Institut Elie Cartan de Lorraine, BP 70239 54506 Vandœuvre-l`es-Nancy Cedex, France (remy.mougenot@univ-lorraine.fr). 1
